comment: Test data for Satellite Visualizer plugin - 10 points over ~10 minutes
description: Low Earth Orbit satellite passing over Europe. Coordinates in Geodetic format (Longitude, Latitude, Altitude in meters)

explanation.time_format: Unix timestamp in milliseconds (Dec 2, 2024, starting at 00:00:00 UTC)

coordinates.longitude: Degrees East (10.0 to 23.5) - moving west to east over Europe
coordinates.latitude: Degrees North (45.0 to 53.6) - moving south to north
coordinates.altitude: Meters above Earth surface (418,000 to 422,000m = ~418-422km LEO)

quaternion.description: Satellite orientation (body frame relative to inertial frame)
quaternion.format: [qx, qy, qz, qs] where qs is scalar component
quaternion.interpretation: Satellite slowly rotating as it orbits

orbit.this_sample: 10 minutes of orbit, 1 point per minute

how_to_use_in_grafana: 1. Open Grafana → Create Dashboard → Add Panel
5. Paste ONLY the 'grafana_raw_frame_format' array above into 'Raw Frame Content'
6. In plugin settings: Set 'Coordinates type' to 'Geodetic'
7. Apply and see your satellite orbit!

alternative_formats.cartesian_ecef: For ECEF coordinates, X/Y/Z would be ~6.7-6.8 million meters from Earth's center
alternative_formats.cartesian_eci: For ECI coordinates, similar magnitude but in inertial reference frame
